faq.question: What is a runbook?
faq.answer: A runbook is a detailed set of procedures and instructions that guide users through specific operational tasks. It ensures consistency, reduces errors, and helps maintain security standards during critical operations.

faq.question: How do I execute a runbook?
faq.answer: To execute a runbook, navigate to the runbooks section, select the desired runbook, and click the 'Execute' button. Follow the step-by-step instructions provided in each step of the runbook.

faq.question: Can I create custom runbooks?
faq.answer: Yes, authorized users (Kelyn admins and representatives) can create custom runbooks tailored to specific client needs and operational requirements.

faq.question: What happens if I encounter an error during execution?
faq.answer: If you encounter an error, stop the execution immediately and contact your administrator or call our emergency support line at 1-800 KELYN for assistance.

faq.question: How are runbook executions tracked?
faq.answer: All runbook executions are logged and tracked in the system. You can view execution history, status, and results in the Executions section of the dashboard.

faq.question: Who can access the Knowledge Base?
faq.answer: The Knowledge Base is accessible to all users regardless of their role. It serves as a central repository for frequently asked questions and cybersecurity terminology.

faq.question: How often is the content updated?
faq.answer: The Knowledge Base content is regularly reviewed and updated by our cybersecurity experts to ensure accuracy and relevance with current industry standards and best practices.

faq.question: Can I suggest new content for the Knowledge Base?
faq.answer: Yes! We welcome suggestions for new FAQ items or acronyms. Please contact your Kelyn representative or submit feedback through your account manager.

faq.question: What should I do during a security incident?
faq.answer: During a security incident, immediately follow your organization's incident response procedures. If unsure, contact our emergency support line at 1-800 KELYN for immediate assistance.

faq.question: How do I reset my password?
faq.answer: To reset your password, click the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page and follow the instructions sent to your registered email address. If you continue to have issues, contact your administrator.

faq.question: What browsers are supported?
faq.answer: Our platform supports all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. We recommend using the latest version of your preferred browser for the best experience.

faq.question: How do I report a bug or technical issue?
faq.answer: Technical issues can be reported through your account manager or by calling our support line. Please provide as much detail as possible including browser type, steps to reproduce, and any error messages.

acronyms.definition: Security Operations Center - A centralized facility where security professionals monitor, detect, analyze, and respond to cybersecurity incidents.
Security Information and Event Management - Technology that provides real-time analysis of security alerts generated by applications and network hardware.
Intrusion Detection System - A security tool that monitors network traffic and system activities for malicious activities or policy violations.
Intrusion Prevention System - A network security tool that monitors network traffic to detect and prevent vulnerability exploits.
National Institute of Standards and Technology - Develops cybersecurity standards, guidelines, best practices, and other resources.
International Organization for Standardization - Develops international standards including cybersecurity frameworks like ISO 27001.
General Data Protection Regulation - EU regulation on data protection and privacy for individuals within the European Union.
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act - US legislation that provides data privacy and security provisions for safeguarding medical information.
Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard - Security standard for organizations that handle credit card information.
Data Loss Prevention - Set of tools and processes used to ensure sensitive data is not lost, misused, or accessed by unauthorized users.
Multi-Factor Authentication - Security system that requires more than one method of authentication to verify user identity.
Virtual Private Network - Technology that creates a secure, encrypted connection over a less secure network.
Advanced Persistent Threat - Prolonged and targeted cyberattack where attackers gain access to a network and remain undetected.
Indicator of Compromise - Pieces of forensic data that identify potentially malicious activity on a system or network.
Security Orchestration, Automation and Response - Collection of software solutions designed to help security teams manage and respond to cybersecurity alerts.
Endpoint Detection and Response - Cybersecurity solution that continuously monitors and collects activity data from endpoints to provide rapid threat detection.
Extended Detection and Response - Security solution that provides unified threat detection, investigation, and response across multiple security layers.
Cloud Access Security Broker - Security policy enforcement point between cloud service consumers and cloud service providers.
Zero Trust Network Access - Security framework that requires strict identity verification for every person and device trying to access resources.
User and Entity Behavior Analytics - Cybersecurity process that uses machine learning to detect anomalous user behavior.
